intro: Nemacladus matsonii, commonly known as the Matson’s spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nemacladus matsonii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
